Action.ActionDescription: Navigates to the specified URL address. Make sure the URL starts with either Http:// or Https://
Switches to a window with the specified title. Partial title is also acceptable if it is enough to distinguish it from other window titles.
Closes the specified window based on its title. Partial title is also acceptable if it is enough to distinguish it from other window titles.
Switches to the specified iFrame based on its specified frame name provided.
Types text into the specified textbox.
Clears any text out of the specified textbox.
Matches the specified data value against the text found in the textbox (character casing does not matter).
Selects an option from the dropdown based on the option's visible text match (character casing does not matter).
Selects an option from the dropdown based on the option's coded value match (character casing does not matter).
Selects an option from the dropdown based on the option's index number (indext starts at 1).
Selects the option with the matching value from the radio button group.
Finds and clicks on the specified web element.
Matches the specified data value against the text found between the elements opening and closing tags (character casing does not matter).
Checks to ensure the specified web element is displayed. The data value is the maximum wait time before the step fails because it cannot find the element, therefore it must be an integer.
Checks to ensure the specified web element is enabled. The data value is the maximum wait time before the step fails because it cannot find the element, therefore it must be an integer.
Checks to ensure the specified web element is selected. The data value is the maximum wait time before the step fails because it cannot find the element, therefore it must be an integer.
Checks to ensure the specified web element is not displayed.
Checks to ensure the specified web element is not enabled.
Checks to ensure the specified web element is not selected.
Waits for the page load status to be set to complete. The data value is the maximum wait time before the step fails because it cannot find the element, therefore it must be an integer.
Looks for the specified text to be displayed on the page.
Takes a screenshot of the current page and names it based on the data value provided.
Switch the alert window, accepts it and then switch back to the parent window. iFrame switch may be necessary.
Switch the alert window, declines it and then switch back to the parent window. iFrame switch may be necessary.
Switch the alert window and match the alert text against the provided data value (character casing does not matter).
Simulates the 'Enter' key press from the keyboard on the specified element.
Simulates the 'Tab' key press from the keyboard on the specified element.
Simulates the 'Shift' key press from the keyboard on the specified element.
Simulates the 'Space' key press from the keyboard on the specified element.
Simulates the 'Backspace' key press from the keyboard on the specified element.
Simulates the 'Pause' key press from the keyboard on the specified element.
Simulates the 'Insert' key press from the keyboard on the specified element.
Simulates the 'Home' key press from the keyboard on the specified element.
Simulates the 'Delete' key press from the keyboard on the specified element.
Simulates the 'End' key press from the keyboard on the specified element.
Simulates the 'Escape' key press from the keyboard on the specified element.
Pause the thread for the specified number of seconds.
Pause the thread for the specified number of milliseconds.
